content.text: Calculate the value of bond D shown in the following table, all of which pay interest semiannually. <image 1>

The value of bond D is $1,077.20.

The value of a bond is calculated as the present value of its future cash flows, discounted at the required rate of return. In this case, the future cash flows consist of the semiannual coupon payments and the par value of the bond at maturity.

The semiannual coupon payment is calculated as follows:

Coupon payment = Par value * Coupon rate / 2
= $1,000 * 14% / 2
= $70

The number of semiannual periods to maturity is calculated as follows:

Number of periods = Years to maturity * 2
= 10 years * 2
= 20 periods

The present value of the coupon payments is calculated as follows:

PV of coupons = Coupon payment * [1 - (1 + Required rate of return)^(-Number of periods)] / Required rate of return
= $70 * [1 - (1 + 5%)^(-20)] / 5%
= $938.60

The present value of the par value at maturity is calculated as follows:

PV of par value = Par value / (1 + Required rate of return)^Number of periods
= $1,000 / (1 + 5%)^20
= $385.60

Therefore, the value of bond D is calculated as follows:

Value of bond D = PV of coupons + PV of par value
= $938.60 + $385.60
= $1,077.20
